author: smartprogrammer
content: I think we shouldn't jump the gun, the idea here is we have an agreed date on when nodes can start dropping history so all clients drop them at the same time and we have a homogeneous network when it comes to history.  Previously, nethermind had barriers that drop history and we changed this to not drop so we can have a healthy network

author: pipermerriam
content: Responsible client design would be to continue serving history over `eth/XX` (the one's that expect it) up until the agreed upon drop date.  Anything else is tragedy of the commons, running forward with a client behavior that is *ok* if only a small number do it, and is problematic if everyone does it.  If the behavior isn't universalizable, it should be locked away behind an experimental flag that requires explicit opt-in.

author: pipermerriam
